title: Sports Game Project
description: A template for sports simulation games. Includes asset pipelines for teams, players, stadiums, and game modes with season/tournament management.

decks.name: Game Rules & Mechanics
decks.description: Core sport rules and gameplay systems. Each card defines a unique rule or mechanic - add sub-cards manually for implementation.

cards.content:
Scoring System

Define how points are scored in your sport.

**Examples to consider:**
- What actions award points? (Goals, touchdowns, baskets, etc.)
- Are there different point values? (2-point vs 3-point shots)
- How do overtimes/tiebreakers work?
- What ends a match? (Time limit, score limit, set count)

> **About This Deck:** Unlike repeatable assets (teams, players), game rules are unique systems. That's why this deck has no journey - you'll create custom implementation tasks as sub-cards for each rule.

Player Stamina System

How fatigue affects player performance during matches.

**Consider:**
- Does stamina drain over time or per action?
- How does low stamina affect stats? (Speed, accuracy, strength)
- How do players recover? (Substitutions, timeouts, halftime)
- Do different positions have different stamina pools?

Stamina System

Players have limited stamina for sprinting and special moves.

**Consider:**
- How fast does stamina regenerate?
- Penalty for depleted stamina?
- Does it affect all actions or just some?

**Why:** Adds tactical depth to movement and ability usage.

Foul & Penalty System

Define when fouls occur and their consequences.

**Consider:**
- What actions trigger fouls?
- Yellow/red card system or simpler?
- Free kick/penalty mechanics

**Why:** Enforces fair play and adds strategic risk.

decks.name: Teams
decks.description: All teams in your game. Add a team card, then start its journey to create it.

cards.content:
Hometown Heroes

Your starter team with balanced stats.

**Team Stats:**
- Overall Rating: 75/100
- Playstyle: Balanced
- Strengths: Versatile roster
- Weaknesses: No standout stars

This card uses the **#starter** tag to mark it as a default team. Use tags to organize teams by league, division, or unlock status.

> **Priority:** This is marked 'a' priority because you need at least one complete team before you can test your game!

Thunder Strikers

An aggressive offensive powerhouse team.

**Team Stats:**
- Overall Rating: 82/100  
- Playstyle: Offensive
- Strengths: High scoring potential
- Weaknesses: Weak defense

Team C: The Defenders

Defensive-focused team with strong goalkeeping.

**Strengths:** High defense stats, goalkeeper bonuses
**Weaknesses:** Slower movement, lower shooting accuracy
**Playstyle:** Counter-attack and solid defense

**Consider:** How to make defensive play fun and rewarding?

steps.content:
Design Team Logo & Colors

Create the team's visual identity (logo, primary/secondary colors, patterns).

Create Team Uniforms

Design home and away jerseys/uniforms using team colors.

Generate Team Roster

Create player list with names, positions, and stats that match team's playstyle.

Implement Team Stats & AI

Code team behavior, formation preferences, and tactical AI.

- [ ] Design implementation approach
- [ ] Write core logic
- [ ] Add edge case handling
- [ ] Write unit tests
- [ ] Code review

decks.name: Players
decks.description: Individual player profiles and stats. Add a player card, start its journey.

cards.content:
Star Forward

A high-value offensive player.

**Position:** Forward/Striker
**Key Stats:** Speed 85, Shooting 90, Passing 75
**Special Ability:** "Power Shot" - 20% chance for unstoppable shot

**Effort Tip:** Notice this has 3 effort points. Quick player additions should be low effort, but stars with special abilities need more implementation work.

Midfielder

Balanced player controlling the center of the field.

**Stats:**
- Passing: High
- Shooting: Medium
- Speed: Medium
- Defense: Medium

**Role:** Link defense to offense, distribute ball

Goalkeeper

Defends the goal with specialized mechanics.

**Stats:**
- Reflexes: Very High
- Positioning: High
- Speed: Low
- Shooting: Very Low

**Special:** Unique controls for diving and catching

steps.content:
Create Player Portrait/Photo

Design headshot or portrait for menus and commentary.

Assign Player Stats

Define all stats (physical, technical, mental) based on position and role.

Implement Special Abilities

Code unique player skills or signature moves.

- [ ] Write core logic
- [ ] Add edge case handling
- [ ] Write unit tests
- [ ] Code review

decks.name: Stadiums & Venues
decks.description: Playable arenas and fields. Add a stadium card, start its journey.

cards.content:
Central Arena

A standard indoor/outdoor venue for regular matches.

**Capacity:** 20,000
**Surface Type:** Grass/Court/Ice (your sport)
**Weather:** Can be affected by rain/wind
**Features:** Standard lighting, no special gimmicks

**Linked Teams:** Hometown Heroes (home stadium)

Championship Stadium

The premium venue for finals and special events.

**Capacity:** 50,000
**Features:** Enhanced lighting, fireworks, VIP sections
**Unlock Condition:** Reach finals in career mode

steps.content:
Design Stadium Layout

Create field/court dimensions, seating arrangement, and camera angles.

Model Stadium 3D Environment

Build the playing surface, stands, and surrounding architecture.

- [ ] Block out basic shapes
- [ ] Refine high-poly details
- [ ] Create low-poly version
- [ ] UV unwrap
- [ ] Texture and materials
- [ ] Test in engine

Add Stadium Atmosphere

Crowd sounds, announcer calls, and ambient audio for this venue.

- [ ] Record or source base sounds
- [ ] Edit and layer audio
- [ ] Add variations
- [ ] Integrate in engine
- [ ] Test in game context

decks.name: Design Notes
decks.description: Design documentation, meeting notes, and playtesting findings. Use this deck to capture design decisions and their rationale.

cards.content:
Design Meeting: Accessibility vs Depth

**Date:** Week 2
**Attendees:** Full team

**Decisions:**
- Simple controls (2-button inputs max)
- Depth through positioning and timing, not combos
- Single-player mode teaches mechanics gradually

**Rationale:** Easy to learn, hard to master creates broad appeal.

Playtesting Notes: Multiplayer Balance

**Session:** Week 6 playtest
**Issues:**
- Team A stats overpowered in current build
- Special moves too easy to spam

**Changes:** Nerfed Team A shooting, added cooldown to specials.
